text: Levente Lengyel (13 June 1933 â€“ 18 August 2014) was a Hungarian chess player. Lengyel gained the title of International Master in 1962 and became a Grandmaster in 1964. His final published rating from the international chess federation FIDE was 2293, although he had not been active for a number of years. At his peak, he was regarded as a strong grandmaster, competing for his nation at the top level and winning medals. He died in Budapest in 2014. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Hungarian chess players Category:Chess grandmasters
title: Levente Lengyel
